summary: the two influenza pandemics of the 20th century, “Asian Influenza (1957/H2N2)” and “Hong Kong Influenza (1968/H3N2)” resulted in the deaths of an estimated 2–3 million people globally. the most effective antiviral drug is the neuraminidase (NA) inhibitor, which target the NA glycoproteins of influenza A and B virus. the essential oil is very appreciated for its characteristic pleasant and long lasting woody, earthy, and camphoraceous odor. it is widely used in traditional Chinese medicine as it presents various types of pharmacological activity according to the composition of the oil [16,17]. CC50 of patchouli alcohol was above 20 mM, which indicated that patchouli alcohol did not affect the growth of MDCK. the antiviral effects of patchouli alcohol were not due to the cytotoxicity. patchouli alcohol showed anti-influenza A (H2N2) activity in a time-dependent manner. it showed best antiviral activity when added at a concentration of 8 M during the replication period with inhibition of the viral replication of 97.68% 2.09% for influenza A. no significant effect was detected when patchouli alcohol was used for pretreatment of cells or viruses or when patchouli alcohol was added during the adsorption phase. biochemical studies have indicated that the bioactivity of NA protein is essential determinant after the replication of influenza A (H2N2) virus. a comparison of efficacy of patchouli alcohol and oseltamivir in vivo mouse influenza model showed that at a dose of 5 mg/kg/day, patchouli alcohol showed obvious protection against the influenza virus. when the dose was lowered to 1 mg/kg/day, patchouli alcohol showed weaker protection (measured by survivors/total) the energy-minimized patchouli alcohol-NA complex has been in equilibrium since about 0.5 ns, and then retains quite stable in the last 19.5 ns. it is consistent with the previous MD results of other NA inhibitors [23,24,25,26,27,28] Arg118, Arg152, Arg152, Trp178, Ala246, Glu276, Arg292, Asn294 and Gln347, especially residues Asp151, Arg152 and Glu276 of the NA protein. it suggests that the NA functions will be affected by the presence of patchouli alcohol, consistent with the above experiments. ouli alcohol and oseltamivir were obtained from Sigma Chemical Co.
